item.title: Markdown cheat sheet
item.description:
Markdown cheat sheet

Last updated: January 31st 2025

Markdown is a lightweight markup language that lets you add formatting elements to plaintext documents. It's used by a lot of SSGs (like mine, HUGO), but also in places like Discord and Reddit among others. Its main advantage is readability and simple syntax.

Different implementations of Markdown vary a bit between software and platforms. This guide is mostly from my own perspective and includes info about features that I personally use the most.

item.title: Full guide to RSS
item.description:
Full guide to RSS

Last updated: January 21st 2025

Table of content

  • What is RSS?
  • Why use RSS?
  • For users: How to use RSS
  • For developers: How to add an RSS feed to your website

What is RSS?

From Wikipedia:

"RSS (which stands for "Really Simple Syndication") is a web feed that allows users and applications to access updates to websites in a standardized, computer-readable format."

In layman terms, basically, RSS is a website's news feed that is standardized and which makes it possible for you to "subscribe" to your favorite website's news feed without actually creating an account there or signing up with your email for a newsletter or anything like that.

item.title: Please, stop posting your artwork to Twitter

item.title: Neocities and the (misguided) idolization of the old web
item.description:
Neocities and the (misguided) idolization of the old web

I get a feeling that a lot of Neocities users are teens, or at least born after 2005 and never really experienced the “old web” personally. I’m saying this because people really need to stop idolizing the “old web” so much.

This might seem hypocritical, after all, isnâ€™t my own website kinda oldish looking? Yes and no. While I do like a lot of design trends from a bygone era and despise a lot of modern web development trends, I still do recognize that there are a lot of things that sucked about the web 1.0.

item.title: Plans for 2025 year
item.description:
Plans for 2025 year

I don’t know why, but I keep struggling to get this website indexed by search engine crawler bots. Supposedly, it should be an automated process, but it just doesn’t seem to work for me. I had to manually submit my page to Google for it to get it indexed, but it only worked with the landing page.

I don’t know… To be honest, I’m at a loss of what causes it, but I suspect that the issue might be with GitHub itself. I looked it up and apparently other people seem to have similar issues with their websites hosted on GitHub pages.
